page.title: 12Family Service at St. James
page.content: The parish church of St.James in Great Horwood is a very active centre of village life. Although the church no longer has a resident rector regular services are held there. Morning Family services begin there at 10.30 a.m. People like to sit in more or less the same place each week. The first thing that happens is that the organist begins to play and the choir processes in.The service begins with the notices followed by a short prayer. Next we sing a hymn or a psalm. After that is a Bible reading. The sermon is optional! - if people don't want to listen they can go into the Tower Room for a discussion. Most adults choose the sermon,whilst most young people choose the discussion. Throughout toddlers are encouraged to express themselves as they wish.
